intro: Amphirrhox surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and succulent stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or violet in color, which bloom during the dry season.
